Crimes.Crime_Name: Fraudulent misrepresentation in public service appointment process
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute over validity of public service appointment
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PSC was functus officio and if promissory estoppel applies
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: False educational credentials provided by applicant
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate invalidity of PSC decision
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Doctrine of functus officio; principle of promissory estoppel
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Authority of PSC to issue a clarifying second decision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged finality of first decision and reliance on continued employment
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: PSC acted within authority to clarify original intent
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: False educational credentials, timing and content of PSC decisions
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles, judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: PSC exceeded authority in issuing second decision
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Common law doctrines and statutory provisions
Crimes.Defendant_Response: PSC asserted authority to clarify its original decision
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of application and credentials

Crimes.Crime_Name: Revocation of public service appointment due to fraud
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Administrative dispute over revocation of appointment
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the PSC was functus officio and if promissory estoppel prevents revocation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: False education credentials submitted during internal appointment
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show PSC acted beyond authority
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 69 of the Public Service Employment Act; functus officio doctrine
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Validity of second decision clarifying revocation
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: PSC lacked authority to reissue decision; alleged promise of continued employment
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: PSC properly clarified original intent without exceeding authority
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: False credentials, text of both PSC decisions
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Public Service Employment Act, administrative law principles
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Second decision was ultra vires and created legitimate expectation
Crimes.Court_Result: Upheld PSC’s authority to clarify decision
Crimes.Defendant_Response: PSC acted within statutory authority to correct record
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Reinstatement or declaration of valid appointment
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Internal appointment process, post-appointment investigation, judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 69, Public Service Employment Act; functus officio
